title: Exploring AP Calculus Concepts in Real-World Scenarios
driving_question: How can we apply calculus concepts to solve real-world problems involving bacterial growth and particle movement?
short_background_context: Students will explore bacterial population growth and particle movement using differentiation, integration, and Riemann sums. Students will model, estimate, and interpret these phenomena.
pre_thinking_prompts: What ideas or thoughts come to mind?

tasks.task_text: Estimate rate of bacterial growth using a table.
tasks.hint: Use difference quotients to approximate the rate of change.

tasks.task_text: Approximate total bacteria mass using a Riemann sum.
tasks.hint: Use left-endpoint, right-endpoint, or midpoint Riemann sums.

tasks.task_text: Analyze particle speed, acceleration, and displacement over time.
tasks.hint: Remember: Speed is the magnitude of velocity; displacement is the integral of velocity.

reflection_prompt: How can calculus concepts deepen your understanding of real-world change and accumulation?
remix_zone: Students remix by applying calculus to population spread, climate modeling, or economic growth.
